title: Magic resistance
data:
- *This article is about the magic resistance [property](/wiki/Property "Property"). For [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster")' magic resistance, see [Magic resistance (monster)](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)").*

**Magic resistance** is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and protects against many types of magical attacks and effects. It is part of most [ascension kits](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit"), and is generally considered a high priority to obtain as soon as possible.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effect](#Effect)
- [2 Obtaining](#Obtaining)
- [3 Monsters](#Monsters)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 Variants](#Variants)
  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [7 References](#References)

## Effect

Magic resistance protects against:

- Death magic from external sources:

  - [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") effect of [Death](/wiki/Riders#Death "Riders")'s [touch attacks](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death")
  - zapped [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") and [finger of death](/wiki/Spellbook_of_finger_of_death "Spellbook of finger of death")
  - the [touch of death](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell")

- Polymorph magic from external sources:

  - vapors from a [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph")
  - [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_traps "Polymorph traps")

- Damage from pure magic:

  - [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") attacks
  - the magic explosion from [breaking](/wiki/Breaking_wands "Breaking wands") any wand, but not necessarily the wand-specific special effect
  - zapped or broken wands of [striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") or [magic missile](/wiki/Wand_of_magic_missile "Wand of magic missile")
  - zapped spells of [force bolt](/wiki/Spellbook_of_force_bolt "Spellbook of force bolt") or [magic missile](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_missile "Spellbook of magic missile")
  - damage from exploding [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook")

- [Teleport](/wiki/Teleportation_trap "Teleportation trap") and [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport_trap "Level teleport trap") traps

- [Energy](/wiki/Energy "Energy") drain from [anti-magic fields](/wiki/Anti-magic_field "Anti-magic field"); they cause damage instead

- Being [scared](/wiki/Scare "Scare") by [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), and the chance of its other effects is reduced

- The [destroy armor](/wiki/Destroy_armor_\(monster_spell\) "Destroy armor (monster spell)"), [drain strength](/wiki/Drain_strength "Drain strength"), and [confuse](/wiki/Confuse_\(monster_spell\) "Confuse (monster spell)") [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell")

- The effect of the [paralyze](/wiki/Paralyze_\(monster_spell\) "Paralyze (monster spell)") and [stun](/wiki/Stun_\(monster_spell\) "Stun (monster spell)") [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") is reduced to one turn

- Damage from the [psi bolt](/wiki/Psi_bolt "Psi bolt") and [open wounds](/wiki/Open_wounds "Open wounds") [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") is halved

- Damage from [artifact blasts](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") is halved

- The number of items cursed by [curse items](/wiki/Curse_items "Curse items") from any source is halved

Magic resistance does **not** protect against:

- [Magic traps](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap")

- Death magic that you pointed at yourself:
  - zapped [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") or [finger of death](/wiki/Spellbook_of_finger_of_death "Spellbook of finger of death") aimed at yourself

- [Polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") magic that you directed at yourself:

  - zapped [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") or [spell](/wiki/Spellbook_of_polymorph "Spellbook of polymorph") of polymorph aimed at yourself
  - broken [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph")
  - quaffed [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph")
  - eating a [chameleon](/wiki/Chameleon "Chameleon") corpse

## Obtaining

**Magic resistance** is granted by wielding [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), wearing a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance"), [gray dragon scales](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scales "Gray dragon scales"), or [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail"), polymorphing into a [(baby) gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon"), or carrying, wearing or wielding certain [Quest artifacts](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").

| Quest artifacts granting magic resistance         |                                                                                                                        |         |           |
| ------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | --------- |
| Role                                              | Artifact                                                                                                               | When    | Alignment |
| [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") | [the Orb of Detection](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Detection "The Orb of Detection")                                              | Carried | Lawful    |
| [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman")                | [the Sceptre of Might](/wiki/The_Sceptre_of_Might "The Sceptre of Might")                                              | Wielded | Lawful    |
| [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")                   | [the Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/The_Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "The Magic Mirror of Merlin")                            | Carried | Lawful    |
| [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk")                         | [the Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/The_Eyes_of_the_Overworld "The Eyes of the Overworld")                               | Worn    | Neutral   |
| [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                | [the Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/The_Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "The Platinum Yendorian Express Card") | Carried | Neutral   |
| [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")                   | [the Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica")                               | Worn    | Neutral   |

## Monsters

In addition to [monster-type magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), some monsters have player-style magic resistance:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- [Baby gray dragons](/wiki/Baby_gray_dragon "Baby gray dragon")

- Monsters with a [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") attack or a random breath weapon that can select magic missile:

  - [Angels](/wiki/Angel "Angel")
  - [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu")
  - [gray dragons](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon")
  - [Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)")
  - [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon").

Anyone coding new monsters should be aware of this somewhat counter-intuitive means of granting intrinsic magic resistance to monsters.

Monsters gain player-style resistance from a worn [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance"), gray dragon scales or scale mail, or from wielding a co-aligned artifact: neutral [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), lawful [Sceptre of Might](/wiki/Sceptre_of_Might "Sceptre of Might"). Carrying quest artifacts also works (especially important in the case of your quest nemesis and the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")), but tame monsters will not keep them unless worn or wielded.

This provides most of the same protections to monsters as it does to the player, e.g. death rays, magic missiles and involuntary polymorphs. It does not make them resist taming or [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict"), as monster-style magic resistance would, nor against [level teleporter](/wiki/Level_teleporter "Level teleporter") traps, as player magic resistance does.

## Strategy

Magic resistance, [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") are among the most important properties to get, closely followed by [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"). Generally, you should [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") to get them or [make gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail#Acquiring_scales_and_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") if you cannot get them otherwise, ideally before the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle").

Relying only on a quest artifact for magic resistance is dangerous in the endgame, because the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") can [steal it from you](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") and become magic resistant himself. He will then absorb any death rays or magic missiles unharmed, while you are left quite vulnerable to his [touch of death](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death"). As of Nethack 3.6.1, the Wizard can steal any quest artifact, not just your own.

Player-style magic resistance is good in a pet, as death rays and polymorph traps lose their threat. If you want to make your pet magic resistant, gray dragon scale mail (or the cloak) are usually best. If you go the artifact weapon route, make sure your pet is carrying as few objects as possible and disarm it with a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") beforehand to keep it from wielding any different artifact it may encounter. Unfortunately, the most useful pet, an [Archon](/wiki/Archon "Archon"), cannot be made magic resistant—pets will not wield quest artifacts (ruling out the Sceptre of Might) or cross-aligned artifacts (preventing Magicbane from working). Thus, only intelligent neutral pets can be made magic-resistant with an artifact weapon.

## Messages

- Boing!

  You or a monster resisted a force bolt or wand of striking due to magic resistance.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

New monsters with player-style magic resistance are [diamond](/wiki/Diamond_golem "Diamond golem") and [crystal golems](/wiki/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem") and adult [shimmering dragons](/wiki/Shimmering_dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shimmering dragon (SLASH'EM)"). In addition, there are many more useful pets capable of wearing body armor, including [astral devas](/wiki/Astral_deva "Astral deva") and [vampire mages](/wiki/Vampire_mage_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Vampire mage (SLASH'EM)").

Also, magic resistance is granted by carrying [the Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa](/wiki/The_Great_Dagger_of_Glaurgnaa "The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa"), [the Stake of Van Helsing](/wiki/The_Stake_of_Van_Helsing "The Stake of Van Helsing"), or [the Crown of Saint Edward](/wiki/The_Crown_of_Saint_Edward "The Crown of Saint Edward"). The Crown will always be lawful, and the Stake is lawful if wished for or if obtained by a lawful Undead Slayer, so they can both be used to give a pet [Solar](/wiki/Solar "Solar") magic resistance.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [resists\_magm](/wiki/Source:Mondata.c#resists_magm "Source:Mondata.c") in [mondata.c](/wiki/Source:Mondata.c "Source:Mondata.c")

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Magic resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article is about the magic resistance property. For monsters' magic resistance, see Magic resistance (monster).

Magic resistance is a property that appears in NetHack, and protects against many types of magical attacks and effects. It is part of most ascension kits, and is generally considered a high priority to obtain as soon as possible.

Contents

  • 1 Effect
  • 2 Obtaining
  • 3 Monsters
  • 4 Strategy
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
  • 7 References

Effect

Magic resistance protects against:

  • Death magic from external sources:
    • instadeath effect of Death's touch attacks
    • zapped wand of death and finger of death
    • the touch of death monster spell
  • Polymorph magic from external sources:
    • vapors from a potion of polymorph
    • polymorph traps
  • Damage from pure magic:
    • magic missile attacks
    • the magic explosion from breaking any wand, but not necessarily the wand-specific special effect
    • zapped or broken wands of striking or magic missile
    • zapped spells of force bolt or magic missile
    • damage from exploding spellbooks
  • Teleport and level teleport traps
  • Energy drain from anti-magic fields; they cause damage instead
  • Being scared by Magicbane, and the chance of its other effects is reduced
  • The destroy armor, drain strength, and confuse monster spells
  • The effect of the paralyze and stun monster spells is reduced to one turn
  • Damage from the psi bolt and open wounds monster spells is halved
  • Damage from artifact blasts is halved
  • The number of items cursed by curse items from any source is halved

Magic resistance does not protect against:

  • Magic traps
  • Death magic that you pointed at yourself:
    • zapped wand of death or finger of death aimed at yourself
  • Polymorph magic that you directed at yourself:
    • zapped wand or spell of polymorph aimed at yourself
    • broken wand of polymorph
    • quaffed potion of polymorph
    • eating a chameleon corpse

Obtaining

Magic resistance is granted by wielding Magicbane, wearing a cloak of magic resistance, gray dragon scales, or gray dragon scale mail, polymorphing into a (baby) gray dragon, or carrying, wearing or wielding certain Quest artifacts.

Quest artifacts granting magic resistance
Role Artifact When Alignment
Archeologist the Orb of Detection Carried Lawful
Caveman the Sceptre of Might Wielded Lawful
Knight the Magic Mirror of Merlin Carried Lawful
Monk the Eyes of the Overworld Worn Neutral
Tourist the Platinum Yendorian Express Card Carried Neutral
Wizard the Eye of the Aethiopica Worn Neutral

Monsters

In addition to monster-type magic resistance, some monsters have player-style magic resistance:[1]

  • Baby gray dragons
  • Monsters with a magic missile attack or a random breath weapon that can select magic missile:
    • Angels
    • Yeenoghu
    • gray dragons
    • Oracle
    • Chromatic Dragon.

Anyone coding new monsters should be aware of this somewhat counter-intuitive means of granting intrinsic magic resistance to monsters.

Monsters gain player-style resistance from a worn cloak of magic resistance, gray dragon scales or scale mail, or from wielding a co-aligned artifact: neutral Magicbane, lawful Sceptre of Might. Carrying quest artifacts also works (especially important in the case of your quest nemesis and the Wizard of Yendor), but tame monsters will not keep them unless worn or wielded.

This provides most of the same protections to monsters as it does to the player, e.g. death rays, magic missiles and involuntary polymorphs. It does not make them resist taming or conflict, as monster-style magic resistance would, nor against level teleporter traps, as player magic resistance does.

Strategy

Magic resistance, poison resistance, and reflection are among the most important properties to get, closely followed by magic cancellation. Generally, you should wish to get them or make gray dragon scale mail if you cannot get them otherwise, ideally before the Castle.

Relying only on a quest artifact for magic resistance is dangerous in the endgame, because the Wizard of Yendor can steal it from you and become magic resistant himself. He will then absorb any death rays or magic missiles unharmed, while you are left quite vulnerable to his touch of death. As of Nethack 3.6.1, the Wizard can steal any quest artifact, not just your own.

Player-style magic resistance is good in a pet, as death rays and polymorph traps lose their threat. If you want to make your pet magic resistant, gray dragon scale mail (or the cloak) are usually best. If you go the artifact weapon route, make sure your pet is carrying as few objects as possible and disarm it with a bullwhip beforehand to keep it from wielding any different artifact it may encounter. Unfortunately, the most useful pet, an Archon, cannot be made magic resistant—pets will not wield quest artifacts (ruling out the Sceptre of Might) or cross-aligned artifacts (preventing Magicbane from working). Thus, only intelligent neutral pets can be made magic-resistant with an artifact weapon.

Messages

Boing!
You or a monster resisted a force bolt or wand of striking due to magic resistance.

Variants

SLASH'EM

New monsters with player-style magic resistance are diamond and crystal golems and adult shimmering dragons. In addition, there are many more useful pets capable of wearing body armor, including astral devas and vampire mages.

Also, magic resistance is granted by carrying the Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa, the Stake of Van Helsing, or the Crown of Saint Edward. The Crown will always be lawful, and the Stake is lawful if wished for or if obtained by a lawful Undead Slayer, so they can both be used to give a pet Solar magic resistance.

References

  1. ↑ resists_magm in mondata.c

This page is based on a spoiler by Dylan O'Donnell. The original license is:

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

  1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
  2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.1. Information on this page may be out of date.

{{otheruses|the magic resistance [[property]]|[[monster]]s' magic resistance|Magic resistance (monster)}}

'''Magic resistance''' is a [[property]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'', and protects against many types of magical attacks and effects. It is part of most [[ascension kit]]s, and is generally considered a high priority to obtain as soon as possible.

== Effect ==
Magic resistance protects against:
* Death magic from external sources:
** [[instadeath]] effect of [[Riders#Death|Death]]'s [[Touch_of_death|touch attacks]]
** zapped [[wand of death]] and {{spell of|finger of death}}
** the [[touch of death]] [[monster spell]]
* Polymorph magic from external sources:
** vapors from a [[potion of polymorph]]
** [[polymorph traps]]
* Damage from pure magic:
** [[magic missile]] attacks
** the magic explosion from [[breaking wands|breaking]] any wand, but not necessarily the wand-specific special effect
** zapped or broken wands of {{of|wand|striking|or=1|magic missile}}
** zapped spells of {{spell of|force bolt}} or {{spell of|magic missile}}
** damage from exploding [[spellbook]]s
* [[Teleportation trap|Teleport]] and [[level teleport trap|level teleport]] traps
* [[Energy]] drain from [[anti-magic field]]s; they cause damage instead
* Being [[scare]]d by [[Magicbane]], and the chance of its other effects is reduced
* The [[Destroy armor (monster spell)|destroy armor]], [[drain strength]], and [[Confuse (monster spell)|confuse]] [[monster spell]]s
* The effect of the [[Paralyze (monster spell)|paralyze]] and [[Stun (monster spell)|stun]] [[monster spell]]s is reduced to one turn
* Damage from the [[psi bolt]] and [[open wounds]] [[monster spell]]s is halved
* Damage from [[artifact blast]]s is halved
* The number of items cursed by [[curse items]] from any source is halved

Magic resistance does '''not''' protect against:
* [[Magic trap]]s
* Death magic that you pointed at yourself:
** zapped [[wand of death]] or {{spell of|finger of death}} aimed at yourself
* [[Polymorph]] magic that you directed at yourself:
** zapped [[wand of polymorph|wand]] or [[spellbook of polymorph|spell]] of polymorph aimed at yourself
** broken [[wand of polymorph]]
** quaffed [[potion of polymorph]]
** eating a [[chameleon]] corpse

== Obtaining ==

'''Magic resistance''' is granted by wielding [[Magicbane]], wearing a [[cloak of magic resistance]], [[gray dragon scales]], or [[gray dragon scale mail]], polymorphing into a [[gray dragon|(baby) gray dragon]], or carrying, wearing or wielding certain [[Quest artifact]]s.

{| class="prettytable"
! colspan="4" | Quest artifacts granting magic resistance
|-
!Role
!Artifact
!When
!Alignment
|-
| [[Archeologist]] || [[the Orb of Detection]] || Carried || Lawful
|-
| [[Caveman]] || [[the Sceptre of Might]] || Wielded || Lawful
|-
| [[Knight]] || [[the Magic Mirror of Merlin]] || Carried || Lawful
|-
| [[Monk]] || [[the Eyes of the Overworld]] || Worn || Neutral
|-
| [[Tourist]] || [[the Platinum Yendorian Express Card]] || Carried || Neutral
|-
| [[Wizard]] || [[the Eye of the Aethiopica]] || Worn || Neutral
|}

== Monsters ==
In addition to [[Magic resistance (monster)|monster-type magic resistance]], some monsters have player-style magic resistance:{{reffunc|mondata.c|resists_magm}} 

* [[Baby gray dragon]]s
* Monsters with a [[magic missile]] attack or a random breath weapon that can select magic missile:
** [[Angel]]s
** [[Yeenoghu]]
** [[gray dragon]]s
** [[Oracle (monster)|Oracle]]
** [[Chromatic Dragon]].

Anyone coding new monsters should be aware of this somewhat counter-intuitive means of granting intrinsic magic resistance to monsters.

Monsters gain player-style resistance from a worn [[cloak of magic resistance]], gray dragon scales or scale mail, or from wielding a co-aligned artifact: neutral [[Magicbane]], lawful [[Sceptre of Might]]. Carrying quest artifacts also works (especially important in the case of your quest nemesis and the [[Wizard of Yendor]]), but tame monsters will not keep them unless worn or wielded.

This provides most of the same protections to monsters as it does to the player, e.g. death rays, magic missiles and involuntary polymorphs. It does not make them resist taming or [[conflict]], as monster-style magic resistance would, nor against [[level teleporter]] traps, as player magic resistance does.

==Strategy==
Magic resistance, [[poison resistance]], and [[reflection]] are among the most important properties to get, closely followed by [[magic cancellation]]. Generally, you should [[wish]] to get them or [[Dragon scale mail#Acquiring scales and scale mail|make gray dragon scale mail]] if you cannot get them otherwise, ideally before the [[Castle]].

Relying only on a quest artifact for magic resistance is dangerous in the endgame, because the [[Wizard of Yendor]] can [[Covetous|steal it from you]] and become magic resistant himself. He will then absorb any death rays or magic missiles unharmed, while you are left quite vulnerable to his [[touch of death]]. As of Nethack 3.6.1, the Wizard can steal any quest artifact, not just your own.

Player-style magic resistance is good in a pet, as death rays and polymorph traps lose their threat. If you want to make your pet magic resistant, gray dragon scale mail (or the cloak) are usually best. If you go the artifact weapon route, make sure your pet is carrying as few objects as possible and disarm it with a [[bullwhip]] beforehand to keep it from wielding any different artifact it may encounter. Unfortunately, the most useful pet, an [[Archon]], cannot be made magic resistant—pets will not wield quest artifacts (ruling out the Sceptre of Might) or cross-aligned artifacts (preventing Magicbane from working). Thus, only intelligent neutral pets can be made magic-resistant with an artifact weapon.

==Messages==
{{message|Boing!|You or a monster resisted a force bolt or wand of striking due to magic resistance.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
New monsters with player-style magic resistance are [[Diamond golem|diamond]] and [[crystal golem]]s and adult [[Shimmering dragon (SLASH'EM)|shimmering dragons]]. In addition, there are many more useful pets capable of wearing body armor, including [[astral deva]]s and [[Vampire mage (SLASH'EM)|vampire mages]].

Also, magic resistance is granted by carrying [[the Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa]], [[the Stake of Van Helsing]], or [[the Crown of Saint Edward]]. The Crown will always be lawful, and the Stake is lawful if wished for or if obtained by a lawful Undead Slayer, so they can both be used to give a pet [[Solar]] magic resistance.
